messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Java and the Spring Boot (Spring MVC / Spring ecosystem) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. To begin this process, I'll provide you with the contents of file `src/main/java/io/github/proxyprint/kitchen/controllers/printshops/ReviewController.java`, your task is to extract all instances of API entries from this file.

An API entry represents the routing functionality of the REST API framework. It refers to the structure that binds a partial or complete request path (called a "path") to a function, class, class method, or object (called a "handler") that processes requests matching that path, either by handling them directly or by dispatching them to other handlers based on the path.

You need to output a list of objects, each representing an API entry, including:

- The HTTP request path, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}). Set this to null if it cannot be determined.
- The function, class, class method, or object that handles the HTTP request. Use exactly "anonymous" to denote an anonymous implementation.
- Whether the handler's implementation (i.e., processing requests and building responses) is present in the same source code file, rather than being imported.
- Whether the path string is a prefix rather than a full path.
- Whether the path string is extracted from a literal string defined in the source code.
- Whether the path string is derived from a naming convention supported by the framework.
- Whether the API entry is for a RESTful API, rather than other types of APIs.
- Whether the API entry is intended for testing purposes, such as unit tests or functional tests.

Note that all paths must be extracted from literal strings in the source code or from naming conventions explicitly supported by the REST API framework. Do not make guesses, if you find a function, class, class method, or object that looks a lot like an API implementation, but the path is not explicitly defined in this file (perhaps in another file), do not include it in your output. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
[
  {
    "path": "/printshops/{id}/reviews",
    "httpMethod": "GET",
    "handler": "io.github.proxyprint.kitchen.controllers.printshops.ReviewController.getPrintShopReviews",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "pathIsPrefix": false,
    "pathFromLiteral": true,
    "pathFromConvention": false,
    "isRestful": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/printshops/{id}/reviews",
    "httpMethod": "POST",
    "handler": "io.github.proxyprint.kitchen.controllers.printshops.ReviewController.addPrintShopReview",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "pathIsPrefix": false,
    "pathFromLiteral": true,
    "pathFromConvention": false,
    "isRestful": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/printshops/{printShopId}/reviews/{reviewId}",
    "httpMethod": "PUT",
    "handler": "io.github.proxyprint.kitchen.controllers.printshops.ReviewController.editPrintShopReview",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "pathIsPrefix": false,
    "pathFromLiteral": true,
    "pathFromConvention": false,
    "isRestful": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/printshops/{printShopId}/reviews/{reviewId}",
    "httpMethod": "DELETE",
    "handler": "io.github.proxyprint.kitchen.controllers.printshops.ReviewController.deletePrintShopReview",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "pathIsPrefix": false,
    "pathFromLiteral": true,
    "pathFromConvention": false,
    "isRestful": true,
    "isTest": false
  }
]

Explanation:
- I extracted four API entries from ReviewController.java corresponding to the four @RequestMapping annotations in the file.
- The "path" values come directly from the literal strings in the RequestMapping(value = "...") annotations; path parameters are kept exactly as they appear in the source ({id}, {printShopId}, {reviewId}).
- The "handler" values are the fully qualified class plus method name for each mapped controller method implemented in this file.
- All methods have their full implementations present in this same source file (method bodies are present), so implementationPresent is true.
- None of the RequestMapping paths are prefix-only mappings — they are explicit endpoint paths — so pathIsPrefix is false.
- The paths are not derived from naming conventions (they are explicit annotation literals), so pathFromConvention is false and pathFromLiteral is true.
- These endpoints are part of a @RestController and return HTTP ResponseEntity objects, so they are treated as RESTful (isRestful = true).
- There is no indication these endpoints are for testing purposes, so isTest is false.
